replies.msg:
Not really familiar with its full history but here is a gist of it.

LIHKG is a relatively new forum in Hong Kong and many of the users here are originally a 20-year old forum called HKGolden, one of the crucial places that gave birth to internet culture of Hong Kong.

Ever since maybe 2016 HKGolden had been criticized for poor management and questionable decision-making. The turning point leading to a massive amount of users leaving the forum was when they decided to block access of third party clients from accessing their service, in order to monopolize their official app. Users felt like they had enough, LIHKG was born, an exodus happened. It's sort of like when Digg users moved to Reddit back in 2010. This place has since become the largest message board in Hong Kong, getting spotlight from mainstream media.

I think that apart from historical reason, the success of LIHKG is contributed by 1. its modern and progressive design compared to competitors, 2. admins lenience towards users and their commitment to protect them, and 3. the dominant youth userbase. Ideas are fresh and creative. The shitposts are hilarious. I believe LIHKG is a HK hybrid of reddit and 4chan, with thoughtful and articulate expressions of the former and the mobility and energy of the latter.

Could you please give us a prove to show you are really an Irish, like taking a photo of your Irish ID card by covering all yr personal details?

I guess your boyfriend can explain to you why and how to do it. You know, there are many 'fake' users recently. It will make us feel like more safer if you do so.

Anyway, thank you for taking time to be here on LIHKG.

The first rule speaking in this forum is ‘no photo no talk’.
U have to prove your identity first.

LIHKG is different because it is not a forum that people can simply use a fake email for register. And new member who joined the forum recently got a "P" license besides their user name. It avoid some asshole to spread fake news or unreal message in this forum. (Although there is still lots of fake news here.) Also, the owner of LIHKG shows his support to HK people and will listen to the forum members.

Because members in LIHKG share a similar political view, which is pro democracy, and anti CPC. This form a very strong and consistent ideology. This is a tradition since we were in HKG.

Also, the account is hard to get, the goverment is unlikely to mobilize great amount of netizens to take effect in our forum.

Moreover, one of the features of this fourm is action oriented. We are willing to take action in the real life, and make something happens.

The above reasons provide a distinctive foundation for social movement, also it shares the features of common online fourms, which multiply the power. All members in the forum are equal and anonymous（we greatly appericiate the fourm holder tried his best to achieve this）. We can freely voice out our opinion toward the movement, regardless our age, social status, and other personal factors. If the opinion is good, people will take it serious and join in. Thus, we join the movement, we lead the movement, and we own the movement. We have deep connection with the movement, as well as toward other members. So we will try our best to make it success, and protect the others.

Several features of lihkg make it so special and popular among hk people.

1. Recognised ISP address only, which is the most important feature in my opinion. It makes lihkg exclusive to only Hong Kong people, which also means that it’s a lot harder for users from China to register accounts and spread messages or false info from China. It also sort of limits users to abuse discussions by registering multiple accounts, at least relatively harder.

2. Servers base overseas, it’s known that lihkg’s servers aren’t based in Hong Kong which means it avoids many legal challenges for political reasons and users’ privacy will be protected

3. Irreversible comments, once you posted a comment or a thread, you can do nothing about editing or deleting the post. Which means users are relatively higher responsible for what they post instead of editing or deleting the post anytime they regret.

4. Voting system, it’s common for any other forum but the one here it plays an important role as a public opinion poll and clearly it directly leads all the movements in these two months. The benefits of the voting system was debatable before the last app update because it could be just some delusions for the herds, it could be misleading and dangerous especially for a collectivist city like Hongkong

5. Influential anonymity in a society, the influence of lihkg comes with its popularity in Hongkong among at least 2 generations, on the other hand the strong protection of users privacy by lihkg makes a perfect atmosphere for the users to discuss and to vote anonymously, and it is certainly a great reason for the user to love it when people can get involved or be influential to the society with their true self disregarding any social norms or any moral burden as they are anonymous. And I believe this is the main reason why lihkg is full of right wings as it is many people’s id, but the superego of many people tell them that the concept of left wing is kinder.

Lastly, welcome to lihkg, thank you for trying to understand Hong Kongese culture.

Lihkg only accepts isp and university’s email for registration. These email addresses are mainly held by university students. This registration policy ensures the quality of discussion and prevent any junk and poor quality comments.

Protesters usually use this function to decide the steps or strategies they will do or adopt. But for me, lihkg is only a platform for protesters to chat. Anyway, I am very appreciated with the work from lihkg admins. They always listen our voice and improve the functions promptly so that lihkg is much user-friendly than other mainstream online forums in hongkong.

Part of lihkg users come from hkgolden after an quarrel with hkgolden admins. (So that hkgolden users also hold an anti-government stance). However, the remaining mainstream online forums, such as Hong kong discuss, babykingdom, yahoo forum, the political stance of their users are mainly pro-establishment and even pro-chinese communist party. TBH there might be disagreements but this is what I observe, some of you might not be happy with me....

Some provincial officials in China are working even better than the HKGov. While there are no "true" elections in mainland China, the local government has to listen to the people's voice, at least for some of the issues, because the officials' career is tied with the success of his administration. As a result while the bureaucrats are brutal in some issues, if they made a serious mistake in misjudging the civilian's thought, they are done. This is also practiced in Singapore and some other "dictatorial Asian countries" where a dictator can still be sort of "democratic" by listening to the public's demand and slowly liberating.

However this is entirely not true for HK. In HK every time the CE has an issue with HK ppl he or she can simply stand behind the CCP by selectively reporting what is happening. Notice: The Chinese officials are actually unfamiliar to what is happening, and no high-rank officials are coming from HK in their system. That makes the CE the person with power but no responsibility since the CPP will always help when shit happens.

Therefore the core problem of HK is actually institutional.

In 2003, HK people were angry at the HK gov about the 85,000 housing policy, and against law 23. Serious discussions in Hong Kong Golden forum that time about protest. I believe that time HKG forum only got around 10,000 members. That said, with 10'000 ppl united and put things in action, it very well could succeed.

After 2003, HKG forum kept growing as the social media leader or voice of protest in HK,including fund raising on newspaper ad, 64 gathering, onward 71 protest and mutli e-mail to US government etc.

Three yrs ago, mobile app changed a lot of things, including HKG. HKG slow to launch a useable app and ppl change to use lihkg, then everything is history.

All told, HK ppl all long know the power of public forum and know how to use public forum to organize protest well since 2003. The available of telegram, ig, Facebook, together with public forum even make it easier to organize, resulting such massive protest today.
